content.description: This is on the right wall, two routes right of Rebal w/o a Pause.  Climbs past 4 bolts to anchors under a  ceiling.  Decent route

This is a fun route that has all the business at the bottom. Crimp past the first two bolts at the bottom, and then enjoy the remaining four bolts to the top. 

  If you head too far left at the bottom the grade drops to 5.10+.
content.location: This is the third route up canyon on the upper right hand said.

content.description: Perhaps the best route in the Black Corridor - it is the obvious line that sits at the mouth of the upper section.  It begins on a terrace then climbs up steep, heavily-chalked huecos.
content.protection: Four bolts to a lower off.

climbs.name: Oils Well that Ends Well
climbs.fa: Jim Steagall  Kevin Sandefur  Chris Werner  Dave Sobocan

content.description: I love this route and IMHO is one of the better routes in the corridor.  The crux bottom is tough small crimpers and really cool 5.10 terrain for a long ways until one last thin crux again at the top!
content.protection: I believe it had 6 bolts to the fixed chains up top.  Pretty easy to set up a top tope from the 757 2X4 route to its right!
content.location: This is the second route on the right wall (West Facing).  Start on the crack/ramp to the right for the first two clips and then move straight onto the very thin face!

content.description: This fun little route is the last one on your right when facing Rebel w/o a Pause and climbs past a very obvious crescent-shaped hold.  The first clip is tough.
content.protection: A few bolts to a lower-off.  Be careful on the first clip!

content.description: This is the corner on the right-hand side of the upper Black Corridor (when facing Rebel w/o a Pause).  Ascend the corner (sandbag at 5.9), then step right w/ difficulty.
content.protection: Six or seven bolts to a lower-off.

content.description:
This is a really fun climb that gets easier the higher you go. The crux involves a balancy corner about a third of the way up, and right below a small roofed edge. 

  The numeric name comes from the fact that it is a 7 bolt 5.7, and a section of a 2x4 plank was used to assist in the anchoring while the route was bolted. 

  **Note: One concern is that the anchors are set back behind the top of the climb, creating a lot of friction on the rope as you lower off. For very small climbers (kids) it can be almost impossible to get enough weight on the rope to get them back to the ground, resulting in some forceful down climbing.  As there are already numerous links on the chains above, the only likely solution would be to add another anchor bolt below the current anchors to reduce the rope drag.
content.protection: 7 bolts to two anchors (one with extended webbing)
content.location: This route is a new addition to the corridor, and a welcomed climb for novices who are not looking to start their day on a 5.9... As you climb above the dividing boulders that separate the lower corridor from the upper, this route is the first on your right, and climbs the right-leaning crack/ramp.

content.description:
This is the upper level of the Black Corridor, separated from the lower level by a pile of boulders and an easy scramble.  

  These routes are on the right side, as viewed from the pile of boulders looking towards Rebel Without a Pause.
